title: sync tabs sign in goes to page:  " Blocked by Content Security Policy  This page has a content security policy that prevents it from being loaded in this way."
content:
Even though I am signed in to the main support page, attempting to sync tabs leads to the page

"Blocked by Content Security Policy

This page has a content security policy that prevents it from being loaded in this way.

Firefox prevented this page from loading in this way because the page has a content security policy that disallows it." at the address: about:accounts?action=signin&entrypoint=preferences

what other ways are availabe to sync?
creator: elvisbeatle

title: Auto Login Process
content:
Firefox. Something serious has happened to the auto log in system. Sometimes I cannot log in to GMAIL at all because it makes an erroneous request. Now I can't login to mailchimp because it goes into a two page login-login loop. I need to swap to Chrome :-(

Latest version. Just logged on.

title: Very long "Waiting to transmit the response" times shown in profiler
content:
Hi,

I encountered an issue where I was getting really slow performance from a server, and I ruled out the server's query as being the issue. I ran the performance profiler, and I found that virtually all of the time was spent in the "Waiting to transmit the response" phase, found in the Network tab of the profile, when hovering over a long bar. In many cases, it was taking over 15 seconds, and there wasn't much information at all being sent from the server.

My question is, what exactly does that phase of the request cover? Could it involve the server not sending data fast enough? A network issue (DNS, proxies, etc.)? The client being low on resources at that moment?

Also, can someone please provide me a list of possible other areas of the profile, or anywhere else, to check to help me narrow down the cause of slow performance in this specific area?

Thanks!
creator: jmyszka
